poem:
**The Grownup Bonnets**

In Copenhagen's pulse,  
a whisper of fabric—  
bonnets reborn,  
shielding from city winds,  
sheepish yet bold.  
Stitched tales weave  
down cobbled paths—  
an ode to old graces,  
softly revolutionized.  
Behind each brim,  
a silent defiance,  
fashioned rebellion—  
a nod to what was,  
a gaze to what will be,  
beneath the northern sky.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "From balabonnets to hoods – what’s behind the trend for grownup bonnets? Hej! Greetings from Copenhagen. I am in the Danish capital for fashion week, now regularly referred to as the “fifth fashion week” after New York, London, Milan and Paris – such is its influence in the industry and beyond. While some of the catwalk trends have divided opinion (not everyone is down for a ballet flat/sneaker hybrid) on the streets, one item gets". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
